bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition identified by LSZ as sores and itching developing on the scrotum and lower limbs. The concept of “kidney wind” appears first in Su wen 素問 42: 腎風之狀，多汗惡 風，面痝然浮腫，脊痛不能正立，其色炲，隱曲不利 , “The appearance of kidney wind [is such]: [patients] sweat profusely and have an aversion to wind. Their face develops a surface swelling of the mang -type. The spine aches and they cannot stand upright. Their [facial] color is [that of] soot. The passage through the hidden bend (i.e. the penis) is impeded”. This definition was accepted by most authors in subsequent centuries, but is quite different from the meaning seen in the Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 , Substance Entry lu 驢 , quoted from the Qi xiao liang fang 奇效良方 : 腎風下注生瘡 , “When kidney wind flows down it generates sores”.
